sentences.en: All pipes protective rings were partly dent on the edge.
sentences.cn: 所有管外涂层部分.轻微锈渍. 擦痕.

sentences.en: Are you living out in this direction now, Miss Dent?
sentences.cn: 你现在在这个方向外出工作吗, 邓特小姐?

sentences.en: Buying that new carpet has made a big dent in our savings.
sentences.cn: 购买那条新地毯已使我们的存款大为减少.

sentences.en: Eight years of effort have hardly put a dent in drug trafficking.
sentences.cn: 八年的努力几乎没有减少贩毒活动。

sentences.en: He sent ten men to mend the dent in the engine's tender.
sentences.cn: 他派了十个人去修理机车头的煤水车上的凹陷.

sentences.en: I found a dent in the left wing of your car.
sentences.cn: 我看见你车左侧的翼子板上有块凹痕.

sentences.en: I was convinced there was a dent in the hood which hadn't been there before.
sentences.cn: 我确信车盖上有一个以前没有的凹痕。

sentences.en: I've been in three bars and I put a dent in all three.
sentences.cn: 我去了三个酒吧每个都留下了我的痕迹.

sentences.en: Losing the match made quite a dent in his ego.
sentences.cn: 比赛失败对他的自尊心打击极大.

sentences.en: NICK: Surface discontinuity, a depression or dent caused by impact.
sentences.cn: 刻痕: 表面中断, 由碰撞引起的下陷或凹痕.

sentences.en: Recently it makes a sizable dent in this prediction.
sentences.cn: 这一预言最近有了很大进展.

sentences.en: That dent is not big enough to be worth hammering out.
sentences.cn: 那个凹陷不大,用不着把它锤平.

sentences.en: The houses on this side of Dent Road stood no higher than 20 feet.
sentences.cn: 邓脱路的这几排房子,从地上量到屋顶,只有一丈几尺高.

sentences.en: The loss put a dent in the team's confidence.
sentences.cn: 这次失败给全队的信心投下了阴影.

sentences.en: The scandal has dented his reputation.
sentences.cn: 这桩丑闻损害了他的名誉。

sentences.en: The stone made a dent in the roof of my car.
sentences.cn: 我的汽车顶让石头砸了个坑.

sentences.en: This is the man who was in the fight with Dent Baxter's men?
sentences.cn: 这就是和丹顿巴斯特手下打架的那个人?

sentences.en: Yet any attempt at significant diversification would seriously dent their value.
sentences.cn: 然而,任何显著实现外汇储备多元化的努力都会严重削弱其价值.

words.tran_cn: 齿列；生齿；[脊椎] 齿系

phrases.tran_cn: v. 削弱；[口]取得有效进展

trans.tran_en: a hollow area in the surface of something, usually made by something hitting it
if you dent something, or if it dents, you hit or press it so that its surface is bent inwards
